intro: Trichogonia spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf trichogonia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features include hairy stems and lobed foliage, which contribute to its distinct appearance. Trichogonia spathulifolia is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
